greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1, a(n)=2*a(n-1) if n is odd, or a(n)=a(n/2)+1 if n is even.
comment: b(1)=1, b(n)=2*b(n/2) if n is even, or b(n)=b(n-1)+1 if n is odd produces the sequence of natural numbers.
Seen as a triangle read by rows: T(1,1) = 1; T(n+1,2*k-1) = T(n,k)+1 and T(n+1,2*k) = 2*T(n,k)+2, 1 <= k <= 2^n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 13 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..13 of triangle, flattened
formula: if n is in A010737 : a(n)=n-1
xref: Cf. A000079 (row lengths), A033484 (right edges), A166060 (row sums), A232642 (duplicates removed).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, May 04 2003
